info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 1 at 10:10PM MDT until August 2 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque NM
info.description:
At 1010 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to 2.75 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.25 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas.
Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Santa Rosa, Santa Rosa Lake State Park, Colonias, Puerto De Luna and Cuervo.
This includes Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 259 and 294.
At 920 PM, Emergency Management reported water 5 inches deep in Santa Rosa on Eight Street near Eddy Avenue. At 950 PM, Emergency Management reported water 6 inches deep in Santa Rosa on Park Lake Drive.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MDT TONIGHT FOR NORTHEASTERN GUADALUPE COUNTY
